title: Wrong Direction
lyrics:
The night thickened
Into black earth
The ground sparked under my feet
I didn’t know
The stars had tumbled down

And the earth had turned in to sky



I should have understood

I should have seen it coming

The signs on the road had changed

The fires on the mountain died

I should have understood

I should have seen it coming

The signs on the road had changed

The fires on the mountain died



I felt ascending

But I really sunk

Everything had turned upside down

As I was struggling

To the mountain peak

I had dug into the grave of our home



I should have understood

I should have seen it coming

The signs on the road had changed

The fires on the mountain died

I should have understood

I should have seen it coming

The signs on the road had changed

The fires on the mountain died



I did follow the bears

But I shunned advice of my brothers

I now study the signs of the heavens

I’ve silenced the words of my sisters



I should have understood

I should have seen it coming

The signs on the road had changed

The fire on the mountain died

I should have understood

I should have seen it coming

The signs on the road had changed

The fires on the mountain died



I . . .

Did I sacrifice a brother?

The fires on the mountain died

I . . . 

Did I silence the words of sisters?

The fires on the mountain died
